thread.title: Catherine Zeta-Jones gives tour of her cavernous closet
thread.title_full: Catherine Zeta-Jones gives tour of her cavernous closet

title: Catherine Zeta-Jones gives tour of her cavernous closet
text: Share this article Share Money might not buy happiness but arranging expensive ensembles by color certainly put a smile on this British beauty's perfect pout. Zeta-Jones was last spotted Friday arriving incognito to New York's JFK Airport with her own staff member carting her Louis Vuitton luggage. The 47-year-old Oscar winner shared a video featuring race car revving noises captioned: 'A zip through my closet! #StyleByZeta' Jealous? The glamorous Welshwoman's walk-in wardrobe is so large that there are deep hallways lining each custom black set of shelves, drawers, and clothing racks Opulence: Catherine clearly has a weakness for quilted Chanel chain bags, spiked stiletto heels, Panama hats, and other designer duds Chic: The Dad's Army actress has amassed a museum-sized collection of accessories and bold beautiful Herm√®s scarves, which were artfully displayed Organized: Money might not buy happiness but arranging expensive ensembles by color certainly put a smile on this British beauty's perfect pout The raven-haired stunner has two children - daughter Carys, 13; and son Dylan, 16 - with her husband Michael Douglas. The Hollywood power couple of 16 years - who once split for six months in 2013 - boast an eye-popping $345M combined fortune together. According to Page Six , the 72-year-old Oscar winner's son Cameron finished his seven-year stint at the Pennsylvania Cumberland Federal Corrections Institute last August and he's penning a tell-all memoir. The reformed 38-year-old - whose mother is Diandra Luker - did time for possession of heroin as well as dealing cocaine and methamphetamine. Dramatic entrance: Zeta-Jones was last spotted Friday arriving incognito to New York's JFK Airport with her own staff member carting her Louis Vuitton luggage Mom can I borrow...? The raven-haired stunner has two children - daughter Carys, 13; and son Dylan, 16 - with her husband Michael Douglas Caviar dreams: The Hollywood power couple of 16 years - who once split for six months in 2013 - boast an eye-popping $345M combined fortune together Tatted: Michael's son Cameron finished his seven-year stint at the Pennsylvania Cumberland Federal Corrections Institute last August and he's penning a tell-all memoir Catherine will next play 100-year-old Gone with the Wind legend Olivia de Havilland in Ryan Murphy's Feud: Bette and Joan, which premieres March 5 on FX. 'She was a tough ball-breaking woman. She went up against the studio, which was rare at the time, and today,' the Tony-winning thespian said at last month's TCA Press Tour - according to Variety . 'There's a bit of an enigma, which I love, but I want to play her stronger than more people would have imagined.' The 1962-set rivaling diva series also features Susan Sarandon, Jessica Lange, Kathy Bates, Judy Davis, Sarah Paulson, and Alfred Molina. Wigging out: Catherine will next play 100-year-old Gone with the Wind legend Olivia de Havilland in Ryan Murphy's Feud: Bette and Joan, which premieres March 5 on FX The Tony-winning thespian said at last month's TCA Press Tour: 'She was a tough ball-breaking woman.
